exec(uint256,address,uint256,address).details: You can return different address, than the one passed as a parameter to override destination addressYou can return different amount of coins, than the one passed as a parameter to override amount of coins that will be sent

params.dest: - destination address, where coins will be sent

returns._0: address - destination address, where coins will be sent
returns._1: uint256 - amount of coins, that will be sent

execERC1155(uint256,address,address,uint.details: you can return different address, than the one passed as a parameter to override destination addressYou can return different amount of tokens, than the one passed as a parameter to override amount of coins that will be sent

params.dest: - destination address, where token will be sent
params.token: - address of ERC1155 tokens smart contract

returns._0: address - destination address, where coins will be sent
returns._1: uint256 - amount of tokens, that will be sent

execERC20(uint256,address,address,uint25.details: You can return different address, than the one passed as a parameter to override destination addressYou can return different amount of tokens, than the one passed as a parameter to override amount of coins that will be sent

params.dest: - destination address, where tokens will be sent
params.token: - address of ER20 tokens smart contract

returns._0: address - destination address, where tokens will be sent
returns._1: uint256 - amount of tokens, that will be sent

execERC721(uint256,address,address,uint2.details: you can return different address, than the one passed as a parameter to override destination address

params.dest: - destination address, where token will be sent
params.token: - address of ERC721 tokens smart contract

returns._0: address - destination address, where coins will be sent

exec(uint256,address,uint256,address).notice: Used to validate coin forwarding, example: ETH

execERC1155(uint256,address,address,uint.notice: Used to validate ERC1155 tokens forwarding

execERC20(uint256,address,address,uint25.notice: Used to validate ERC20 tokens forwarding

execERC721(uint256,address,address,uint2.notice: Used to validate ERC721 tokens forwarding

@author Dmytro Pintak <dmytro.pintak@gmail.com>
 @title Rule interface, can be implemented by any contract to be used as a rule in Traffic.sol contract
